metadata.synopsis: Jaheira at a party orginized by Withers.Variants:Retired: We convinced Minsc not to rely on Jaheira to tell him what to do, and now he's thriving as a check on the Guild. Her children are also stepping up into prominent roles, and after six months Jaheira`s beginning to itch for the road once more. She`ll choose to travel on from our campsite rather than return to the city, High Harper no more.Not Retired: We never resolved Minsc and Jaheira`s differences, and so now she`s stuck keeping an eye on him while spinning every other High Harper plate. She`s still happy - just a little more tired.

139.speaker: Jaheira
139.text: Why are you looking at me so? I'm enjoying myself. You look upon fun Jaheira.
139.context: NodeContext: Just about selling that she's having fun, but still ultimately quite serious.

140.speaker: Jaheira
140.text: Good evening again, young Harper. Ensure you ever-maintain balance between drink, water, and nourishment on a night like this.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Try to make a Harper sign.

59.context: CinematicNodeContext: player tries to make a harper hand gesture

167.speaker: Jaheira
167.text: 'Safe place here', eh? Very good. That isn't one you learned from me.

166.context: CinematicNodeContext: player fails to make a harper hand gesture

186.speaker: Jaheira
186.text: Oh. You should not say that in polite company.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: One thing - Minsc got himself into some trouble with the Zhentarim.

185.speaker: Jaheira
185.text: The man just makes friends wherever he goes, no? Fine, then. I shall keep him from jumping back through a portal in the morning.

256.speaker: Jaheira
256.text: Or perhaps follow him and give the Zhentarim a talking to, if my head is sore enough.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Can we say my Harper responsibilities to maintain balance start tomorrow?

293.speaker: Jaheira
293.context: NodeContext: Completely flat - she's joking, but shouldn't show it.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: Well, sorry to spoil the fun - but it seems Minsc has landed himself in a Zhentarim cell.

162.speaker: Jaheira
162.text: I won't send too many letters back to the Gate while I'm away. I will try to enjoy solace. Though you look disbelieving.

287.speaker: Jaheira
287.text: I think on the next place to visit. There is a wizard in Thay who I swore to check up on now and again...

214.speaker: Jaheira
214.text: Perhaps I shall take Minsc. A return to Rashemen might keep him out of trouble... in every place but Rashemen, at least.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Can we stay a night at Candlekeep on the way? I've got enough books to donate.

126.speaker: Jaheira
126.text: You are free to enter the monks' library. But if I am to be sent to sleep, I shall find a nice comfortable inn outside the walls.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I can't wait to see what Minsc is like when back home in Rashemen.

127.speaker: Jaheira
127.text: He is not permitted to return without his Wychlaran; I am surprised he asked me to go.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Perhaps he has found a new Wychlaran, after all.

33.speaker: Jaheira
33.text: Don't even start down that path. I don't like where you're headed...

209.speaker: Player
209.text: Considering all you and Minsc have done, I think we'd be welcomed.

208.speaker: Jaheira
208.text: Or perhaps the Rashemaar have forgotten us. It would make a refreshing change, if that is so.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Ooh, ooh, can we go to Amn?

210.speaker: Jaheira
210.text: Do you have 10,000 spare gold, so we can bail you out, if we get caught casting magic?

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Don't you have a friend in Evereska you haven't seen in a long time?
134.context: InternalNodeContext: Note: This is a reference to Xan, one of the other popular companions from bg1

180.speaker: Jaheira
180.text: The miserable Graycloak? I hope he has lived all this while - with a Moonblade hanging over his neck, he never expected to.

161.speaker: Jaheira
161.text: He told me once that he was maddeningly in love with our last Bhaalspawn friend. Beneath sorrow, there was heart. Perhaps he is due a visit.
161.context: InternalNodeContext: this is fanservice reference to the fact Xan is by far the bg1/2 character who was the most popular subject of the romance modding community

168.speaker: Player
168.context: InternalNodeContext: Note: This is a reference to Edwin, one of the other popular companions from bg1

15.speaker: Jaheira
15.text: That Red Wizard is the only person Minsc doesn't seem to have a heart to forgive.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: If we are nearby, we will do well to check he isn't up to anything - and I can't wait to see the shock on his face when he sees Minsc yet lives.

182.speaker: Jaheira
182.text: We can discuss this tomorrow. We could spend all evening chattering about where to go.

263.speaker: Jaheira
263.text: A toad in the form of a necromancer. I can only hope he has had the decency to die since our last meeting.

316.speaker: Jaheira
316.text: Well, now. You can make yourself presentable, when you have a mind to.
316.context: NodeContext: Fond, eyeing the player up and down. The first time she's seen them in six months - everyone`s dressed up for a party (Except for any players who have been in the Hells)

300.speaker: Jaheira
300.text: Your higher form has brought with it some higher manners, then.
300.context: NodeContext: referring to the player`s mind-flayer form

274.speaker: Jaheira
274.text: Hah! Forgive me - I am simply excitable. It is good to be out under an open sky once more.
274.context: NodeContext: 'don`t mind me` - genuinely glad to be out of the city for a night

82.speaker: Player
82.text: These days it's rather effortless. Godhood does wonders for one's sense of style...

110.speaker: Jaheira
110.text: I'm glad the months have not been wasted. Particularly as I spent them cleaning up the mess we made of the city.
110.context: NodeContext: Not real reproach - just letting the player know she`s been doing all the REAL work

50.speaker: Jaheira
50.text: You must be glad to have Baldur's Gate back as you found it, Duke.
50.context: NodeContext: Wry, no great deference to the title (speaking to Wyll in the flow where he`s become a duke)

70.speaker: Jaheira
70.text: Same twisting alleys for purse-pickers. Same wooden buildings, ready to get burnt by next year's dragon. Same cisterns overflowing...
70.context: NodeContext: Not real distaste - she`s resigned herself to the city never changing

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Our people find honour in the fact our city always comes back fighting fit - on the streets, I see hope on every face.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I never saw Tu'narath. I do not know that which was meant to be my heart. The Gate means more.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I fight for Tu'narath, but I do not know it as I know the Gate. Tu'narath is necessary, but the Gate I have felt for.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: The old family home on Fabrey Lane - it's still standing?

241.speaker: Jaheira
241.text: I checked it myself. The master of masons was reluctant to release funds for work in the Outer City, but your neighbours proved... persuasive.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: The Waterdhavian scholar Yusuf Taji has been developing a grid-theory for city planning... Are the Baldurians not aware?

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: Baldurians simply... get on with it. Stubbornness? Civic spirit? Plain stupidity? Perhaps all three - but nothing I will sniff at any longer.
26.context: NodeContext: Trying to some up why she`s come to like Baldurians, can`t quite put her finger on it

69.speaker: Jaheira
69.text: Harpers have come from half the world over to lend aid. Farmers, masons, healers...

97.speaker: Jaheira
97.text: My own son Jord has been wooed to their ranks. Already he plans crop cycles in Wyrm's Crossing.
97.context: NodeContext: Hint of irony that her son is following in her footsteps after all her shit-talking about the Harpers

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: Not so for my daughter. Rion's rejoined the Flaming Fist - temporarily, you understand, to 'organise the craftsmen'.
55.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastic on the `temporarily` - quoting Rion directly, when they both know she`ll likely stay within the Fist`s ranks

172.speaker: Jaheira
172.text: Though she spends more time locking up comrades for pocketing aid funds. They might learn a thing or two, if they don't expel her. Again.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: All well and good, but what about you? I want to hear what you've been up to.

220.speaker: Jaheira
220.text: Honestly? Much more sitting down than I'd like.

30.speaker: Jaheira
30.text: Mistake me not, there is still much to be done. Plans to make. Maps to be frowned over.
30.context: NodeContext: `Don`t get me wrong, there`s lots to do` - but her children are more and more taking on roles of responsibility in their own right

304.speaker: Jaheira
304.text: But my children are more than capable of doing it. Even the young ones tire of me peeking over their shoulders.

248.speaker: Jaheira
248.text: This night offers them a brief respite from me, at least. And this place, now I look at it... it is where you all spent your first night together, no?
248.context: NodeContext: Eyeing up our first camp, the thought of just staying out here in the wilderness beginning to dawn

253.speaker: Jaheira
253.text: A fine spot for an adventure to begin. A fine spot indeed.
253.context: NodeContext: Coy, eyeing up the place - should communicate that she plans on leaving to travel alone in the morning. She's not leaving her kids or the city - just getting away for a while to figure out what's next now all the fighting is done. As retired as Jaheira is going to get.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Do you have an adventure in mind?

14.speaker: Jaheira
14.text: Just... a little wander, perhaps. To stretch the legs.
14.context: NodeContext: Playing it down, but knows we`re on to her

254.speaker: Jaheira
254.text: I'll find my way back, as I always do. I admit defeat. Baldur's Gate is my home.
254.context: NodeContext: Assuring us that she`s not gone forever (and NOT abandoning her kids)

136.speaker: Jaheira
136.text: But that is the thing about home. The only way to see it clearly is to leave and look back. For a little while, at least.
136.context: NodeContext: She's going to travel and adventure alone for a bit, without the titles, fame or any of the burdens that go with them. But she`ll be back.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: There's no end in sight to my travels, for now.

230.speaker: Jaheira
230.text: The same might be said for all of us, I'd wager. But so long as our paths have thrown us together... I say we make the most of it.

282.speaker: Jaheira
282.text: Be well, cub. We will speak again. But first -
282.context: NodeContext: Sincere - this is her goodbye (for now)

169.speaker: Jaheira
169.text: Now, before this night grows any deeper -

190.speaker: Jaheira
190.text: I must inspect the refreshments. You never know - some ne'er-do-well might have tampered with the wine.
190.context: NodeContext: This is her goodbye - for now. Soft callback to her spiking our wine on our first meeting.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: No matter how far away I may be, the Gate will always be first in my heart.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: No matter how far away I may be, Waterdeep will always be first in my heart.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Where we are standing now, this campsite, is my home, even when I am far away.

121.speaker: Jaheira
121.text: Agh, sentiment. With the greatest affection - I can think of better ways to sour our stomachs.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Tu'narath is my home to come, after the ash and dust settle from our last battle.

309.speaker: Jaheira
309.text: And I wish you fortune in it. But for tonight, I would say we're safe to lay aside our weapons, no?

195.speaker: Player
195.text: My comrades learn by my side the lessons of kin taught to me by Faerûn.

305.speaker: Jaheira
305.text: Whatever you learned, Lae'zel - you were your own teacher.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: If you are ever interested in a trip to Elysium, I can put in a word for you.

92.speaker: Jaheira
92.text: Grey I may be, but I'm in no hurry to see any afterlife before my time. We wouldn't want to spoil the novelty, now would we?

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Elysium is more than a home; it is my domain.

234.speaker: Jaheira
234.text: Of course. Be sure to kick the mud from your boots before returning, then. But while you're here among the mortals, why not enjoy it?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I guess Avernus is all I've got. I should own it.

319.speaker: Jaheira
319.text: Hell is not your home, Karlach. And if your friends do not drag you out of it, it will only be because you've freed yourself first.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Karlach and I are each other's home, in wild Avernus.

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Karlach is lucky to have you. And know that you are not forgotten - if your friends don't drag you from the hells, it will only be because you've freed yourselves first.

165.speaker: Jaheira
165.text: But there will be more to discuss on that matter. First -

124.speaker: Player
124.text: The Gate is my home still. I will return, I hope, after my work in Avernus is done.

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.text: Karlach is lucky to have you. And know that you are not forgotten - if your friends don't drag you from the hells, it will only be because you've freed yourselves first.

205.speaker: Jaheira
205.text: For all your travels, I hope you have arrived where you want to be. Home, whatever that means to you.
205.context: NodeContext: turning the topic back to us

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Where we are standing now, this campsite, is my home, even when I am far away.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: No matter how far away I may be, the Gate will always be first in my heart.

277.speaker: Player
277.text: Minthara is my home, as unbelievable as it might sound.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I have many homes. One of them is in a treehouse.

227.speaker: Jaheira
227.text: Quite a bit of climbing, then. I have no doubt the archdruid keeps you active - but perhaps you can spare the details for later.
227.context: NodeContext: Player referencing their relationship with Halsin - Jaheira`s heard plenty until she`s had a drink

114.speaker: Jaheira
114.text: But I see the flush in your cheeks when I speak of family. Perhaps you mean to start one of your own?
114.context: NodeContext: turning the topic back to us

174.speaker: Jaheira
174.text: I don't want to watch over a blood-match where the duellists call me 'auntie'. Just be careful, Bhaalspawn.

236.speaker: Jaheira
236.text: All right, Bhaal-child. It is true you are no longer what you were. You have done well for yourself.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: If I just have one, they'll have no one to duel.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: 'Auntie'? No way. You hardly ever write back to your own children. They'll call you 'Jaheira'.

308.speaker: Jaheira
308.text: But, should a mother wish to know how her children are faring - not worrying, mind, only wondering -

171.speaker: Jaheira
171.text: Perhaps you might write and tell me of them. And of you, too.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'll do more than that. I'd like to join the Harpers myself - if you'll have me.

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: The Harpers welcome any into their ranks, so long as their soul is willing. You've proven you have one, mind flayer or no.
71.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she can`t stop us joining

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: I have lived many lives. It is only right you be allowed to live another. Take this.

44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira gives the player her harper pin from her own chest.

307.speaker: Jaheira
307.text: When you forsook Bhaal, I know you lost your only place in the world, even if it was one that you needed to lose.

6.speaker: Jaheira
6.text: I wished at that very moment to give you a new purpose: to invite you to the Harpers. You were ready. You were worthy.

246.speaker: Jaheira
246.text: I wanted you to have time. For you to come to me, and say as you have said. To choose for yourself, rather than have a destiny thrust upon you.

247.speaker: Jaheira
247.text: You will make the very best of Harpers, Bhaalspawn. Take this. The old harp of harmony. You know its song.

255.speaker: Jaheira
255.text: The Blade already stands for much that our order does. There is no doubt you have proven you would make one of the finest.

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: Huh. Once I would have never expected such words from a creature of the night. But you have saved the city.

132.speaker: Jaheira
132.text: You speak with truth in your heart. Here, then. Take this.

303.speaker: Jaheira
303.text: You think people look to you now to solve their every quibble? Try wearing that pin. But you will wear it well.
303.context: NodeContext: Snorting, amused at what the player is letting themselves in for - but proud also

133.speaker: Jaheira
133.text: There is usually a ceremony. Reciting of oaths, singing of songs - I'm sure we'll get to all of that as the drinks flows.
133.context: NodeContext: Glossing over the stiffer parts of the ceremony - it`s a party, after all

224.speaker: Jaheira
224.text: For now, I give you only the most simple Harper creed - to look for the light, and watch always for the dawn. But to enjoy the night while we have it, hm?
224.context: NodeContext: `look for light / dawn` is an official Harper saying - the last part is her own fond addendum

86.speaker: Jaheira
86.text: After the tug of war the gods have played for you, you want to flee to a secular order? Hah. I can see it.

142.speaker: Jaheira
142.text: I would have laughed in Viconia's face. But you? Shar or no, you have shown your devotion to the people of the Sword Coast. We do not discriminate on faith.

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: No bigger group of misfits would you find - you won't be the first stray githyanki who wandered over our hearth.

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: Is this just a ploy to read the tomes on Myth Drannor the Twilight Hall keeps, which cannot be accessed by those not sworn?

198.speaker: Jaheira
198.text: The Harpers have a branch in Waterdeep. Show them this, tell them an old lady sent you.

317.speaker: Jaheira
317.text: Gale, get you back to Waterdeep. Our archives don't need a bookworm infestation.

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: The very Grand Duke, a Harper? You know, we are under vow to keep a low profile. No, my liege. Your alliance is grace enough.

49.speaker: Jaheira
49.text: In walking in the sun, you have forgotten how to keep to the shadows. You would betray the Harpers faster than you could drop your pin.

213.speaker: Jaheira
213.text: You have your place. I have mine.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I will write to you, when we are apart.

157.speaker: Jaheira
157.text: Still, we need not begin with the fare thee wells just yet. We have tonight.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You should be proud of yours.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm still not sure where my place is.

218.speaker: Jaheira
218.text: Here and now - that is enough for tonight, no?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I cannot fault you for that.

72.speaker: Jaheira
72.text: You want to join the Harpers? Even after all you have seen? Hah!

75.speaker: Jaheira
75.text: All right. I won't deny any willing arm for the cause. Even those who should know better.
75.context: NodeContext: Wry, shaking her head fondly - we still want to be a harper after all her bad-mouthing.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'll have the Flaming Fist keep an eye on them.

56.speaker: Jaheira
56.text: Rion will appreciate the attention from her comrades, I have no doubt.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'll make sure none of my new sires try to feed on your children.

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: My children can make sure of that themselves, I promise you. But we come together in the spirit of friendship tonight, do we not?
22.context: NodeContext: Jovial, but hint of threat beneath - she doesn`t like this version of Astarion (vampire lord) and doesn`t take kindly to this threats/ suggestions

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I'll have some of my Sisters keep watch.

318.speaker: Jaheira
318.text: No need. I know you Sharrans must have so very much on your minds - better they forget where to find my family home.
318.context: NodeContext: Dry, does not like this version of Shadowheart - not interested in help.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'll make sure they don't fall in with the wrong sort. No taverns, no brothels, and no cults.

219.speaker: Jaheira
219.text: Ha! Well, it's a relief to know a friend is there for them, in your way.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: I can instantly project news of any misbehaviour into your cranium, if you will let me inside.

89.speaker: Jaheira
89.text: You are meant to be an evolved being, are you not? I'm sure you can master quill and parchment.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Only if you promise to write back.

244.speaker: Jaheira
244.text: And... I vow to send them word of my own wanderings. If only to spare me Rion's wrath next I return.

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.text: If you really want to help, you'll get Minsc out of trouble for me. Spare me that adventure.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I'm not sure how much I'll be around the Gate.

229.speaker: Jaheira
229.text: Then I wish you well on your travels. You need not stay to look after the city. Duty without choice is servitude.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: You're just fretting - let life take its course.

273.speaker: Jaheira
273.text: The druid in me hears the wisdom there. But the mother knows best.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: I'd prefer to travel with you - I need a break, too.

271.speaker: Jaheira
271.text: Do you, now? I never said it would be restful. First, let us enjoy tonight.

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: If you still want to journey away on the morrow, come and find me. Together, we will try hard not to have an adventure.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: Although we might have to undertake a brief quest to rescue Minsc first.

104.speaker: Jaheira
104.text: Perhaps I'll wake to greet the dawn. Take a walk, and see where my legs take me.
104.context: NodeContext: Playing it down, but knows we`re on to her

138.speaker: Player
138.text: You're not going back to the city, are you?

87.speaker: Jaheira
87.text: Of course I am. Perhaps just... the long way around. It would be good to stretch my legs for a bit.
87.context: NodeContext: Playing it down, but knows we`re on to her

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Don't go getting any ideas about wandering off. Your children need you.

310.speaker: Jaheira
310.text: And I them. But I cast a little more shade than I would like, and they are only beginning to see the sun.

39.speaker: Jaheira
39.text: Which is my way of saying - I'd like to see the open road once more. Just for a time.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You must be proud of them.

290.speaker: Jaheira
290.text: I suppose I am, though they seem determined to make me redundant.

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: Ah - yes. Forgive me. There wasn't much time to offer hospitality with an elder brain looming over the city.
13.context: NodeContext: A little abashed - now realizing she never introduced us to her family (in this specific case)

222.speaker: Jaheira
222.text: They've heard of you, if it's any consolation.

201.speaker: Jaheira
201.text: The Beloved Ranger? Beloved wherever he goes - winning all sorts over to our rebuilding efforts.
201.context: NodeContext: Snort of amusement - genuinely impressed at how well Minsc is doing

177.speaker: Jaheira
177.text: Minsc has the Guild and Nine-Fingers on board. Deep down, it seems even the wicked can be moved to care for the city that made them.
177.context: NodeContext: Amused at the pairing, but proud of both

164.speaker: Jaheira
164.text: Of course, many of the wealthy fled the city when danger struck. Perhaps the thieves only want to lure them back. But for now their hands are busy laying bricks.

188.speaker: Jaheira
188.context: NodeContext: Shrug - she`s less and less needed, it seems

267.speaker: Player
267.text: All well and good, but what about you? I want to hear what you've been up to.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You must be proud of them.

286.speaker: Jaheira
286.text: I suppose I am. I tried to steer them clear of my life's work - but they have chosen it for themselves.

283.speaker: Jaheira
283.text: They ask about you, of course. But I keep them a little too busy for stories.

265.speaker: Player
265.text: I'm afraid you have another child to deal with. Minsc's been captured by the Zhentarim.

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: ... well. Of course he has. I suppose I shall have to add a visit to their quarters to an already long list.
63.context: NodeContext: Long-suffering sigh - hearing Minsc got himself into trouble again is not really news, just another headache.

231.speaker: Jaheira
231.text: There is much still to do. People to house. A Harper network to rebuild.
231.context: NodeContext: Slight hint of weariness - she`s in no danger of being able to reture any time soon

23.speaker: Jaheira
23.text: I may have little love for this city, but so long as my family chooses to serve it - I can do no less.
23.context: NodeContext: Smile and shrug - it is what it is

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Let me lend my hand - I want to join the Harpers, if you will have me.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Bhaal loves the Gate like he loves his own children. I worry he will strike again.

187.speaker: Jaheira
187.text: I doubt it will be in your lifespan, or even mine - but you are wise to be cautious.

194.speaker: Jaheira
194.text: Uphold your watch, and I will uphold mine. Learn all you can of Bhaal, and leave record of all you learnt.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I will talk to my Father, see if his Fists can take on more of your work.

181.speaker: Jaheira
181.text: Thank you, Wyll. My own daughter is in the Fist. I would not have encouraged her to join, if I did not believe in Ravengard's legacy.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: When your time comes, the Gate's grandest statue will be made of you, right in the heart of the Wide. The hero of our age, and the last.

150.speaker: Jaheira
150.text: What? So every passing pigeon can paint me all in white? Don't waste your marble.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Then my Fists and Council have not done enough. Come to my office tomorrow. I'll try to take on some of your burdens.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You should come to one of my parties - it will definitely take your mind off work.

191.speaker: Jaheira
191.text: Obliged, my lord, but I think I'd rather see Baldur's Gate become a battlefield again, first.
191.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastic, not interested in Lord Astaron`s parties.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: It takes time to heal and rebuild. But if anyone can do it, you can.

120.speaker: Jaheira
120.text: Astarion, I knew you would spare me a kind thought. But it is still strange to hear a kind word. You have clearly been drinking - and I will need to catch up.
120.context: NodeContext: Mock-surprise at Astarion being sincerely concerned - but grateful

125.speaker: Player
125.text: You bear your burdens with grace.

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: Do I? I don't mean to. Being a Harper is like trying to roll a jotun up a sliding glacier.

289.speaker: Player
289.text: I have not yet found my next calling. Would a Githyanki be permitted to march with the Fist?

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: I appreciate your concern for the city's defence, Lae'zel - but you are worth more than one soldier and more than ten Fists.
36.context: NodeContext: Smile, touched that Lae`zel would offer to enlist to help the city - but thinks she`d be wasted there

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: I hope the city might call on you when needful, but you've followed enough orders for your time.

268.speaker: Jaheira
268.text: But tomorrow's problems may wait there for the moment. The city will trundle on without aid for just one night.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Give me your budgets, and I will help with your calculations.

262.speaker: Jaheira
262.text: If we can be discreet, I am not one to turn down a sharp mind - or an even sharper hivemind, in that case.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: I'm sorry you've had so much work - but there's no one better to do it.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Look after yourself, Jaheira. I hope you can rest soon.

163.speaker: Jaheira
163.text: The songs of my suffering will break hearts from here to the Hordelands, I am sure.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: The Bhaal Temple still stands through the carnage...

258.speaker: Jaheira
258.text: An empty throne, thanks to you. The city will not be long in burying it.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I heard rumours the Upper City was destroyed beyond reconstruction.

250.speaker: Jaheira
250.text: The Upper City has been almost entirely rebuilt - that's where the gold is. Even the builders' scaffolds are cleared from the streets. No dust left to sneeze at.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: Not all cities can be as beautiful as Evereska. Baldur's Gate is itself. That is what matters.

183.speaker: Jaheira
183.text: I knew an Evereskan Graycloak who would say 'Baldur's Gate will be the death of me, but I can't say it doesn't hold all of life.'

291.speaker: Player
291.text: Then the architects of Baldur's Gate lack ambition. Had they grander vision, a greater city would rise from the ashes.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: The city just won't die. Like so many of us.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: And just as well. It's no fun vying for power over a ruin.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You're not happy to see the city restored to its former glory?

243.speaker: Jaheira
243.text: Do you know - I am. I have been known, on occasion, to speak ill of Baldur's Gate. But the city is more than her squalid streets.
243.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - au contraire, she accepts the city as it is now

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It's a kip, but it's our kip. I wouldn't change a thing.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I've grown so fond of the city - more than my birth-home, in some ways.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: How do you think the rebuilding is going?

109.speaker: Player
109.text: What are the Harpers up to?

160.speaker: Jaheira
160.text: What else? Helping, whether I ask for it or no.
160.context: NodeContext: Wry - fond of Harpers even though they stick their noses in.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: I've learned a lot since last we met.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: What kind of greeting is that?

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: An unworthy one. Forgive me - I am simply excitable. It is good to be out under an open sky once more.
28.context: NodeContext: Only slight note of apology

153.speaker: Jaheira
153.text: My first since the reconstruction began. We left quite a mess behind, but the city begins to look something like itself once more.

100.speaker: Jaheira
100.text: Hah. How nice to be understood again. I have spent the past months bickering with builders and bankers - all to restore the city exactly as it was.

202.speaker: Jaheira
202.text: And you've never looked more yourself. It's good to see you, Karlach.
202.context: NodeContext: Fond - Karlach turned up to the party covered in dust / armour while everyone else is dressed up.

314.speaker: Jaheira
314.text: I've been thinking of you, these past months of rebuilding. How we had better leave your city as you remember it, for your home-coming.
